caption.p: Phylogenetic tree indicating the relationship between the Cetartiodactyla, Perissodactyla and the Carnivora, represented by the cats and dogs (adapted from Hassanin et al., 2012 ). Red branches indicate clades with a carotid rete, capable of selective brain cooling. Black branches designate the absence of a carotid rete (Hippopotamidae largely data deficient). Also depicted in various shades are the Ruminantiamorpha (green), Whippomorpha (blue), Camelidamorpha (orange) and Suinamorpha (yellow).
